revealed_symptoms.pruritus: It’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin.
revealed_symptoms.erythema: The skin around it looks red or puffy, like it’s irritated or reacting to something.
revealed_symptoms.spontaneous bleeding: Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.
revealed_symptoms.shiny or waxy bump: It looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away.

hidden_symptoms.telangiectasia: There are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before.
hidden_symptoms.evolving: This thing keeps changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before.
hidden_symptoms.induration: It feels thicker or harder than the rest of my skin, like there's something under there.
hidden_symptoms.asymmetry: One side of this mole looks different from the other, like it's lopsided or uneven.
hidden_symptoms.border irregularity: The edges are all jagged, kinda messy, not smooth like my other moles.
hidden_symptoms.satellite lesions: There are these little dots or spots popping up near the main one, like it’s spreading.
hidden_symptoms.rapid growth: I swear this mole or bump got bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks.
hidden_symptoms.hyperkeratosis: There's this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels.

patient_history.content: Hi, I'll be your doctor today. What brings you in?

Well, doc, I've got a few things going on. There's this spot that's super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin. The skin around it looks red or puffy, like it’s irritated or reacting to something. Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it. And it looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away.

Thanks for the detailed information. I understand you're experiencing an itchy, tingly, red, and sometimes bleeding skin lesion. Can you tell me where on your body this spot is located? Also, how long have you had this spot?
I can't tell you the exact location, but I've noticed this for a few months now.
Thank you. Since you've had this for a few months, has the appearance of the spot changed at all? Also, has it been painful or tender to the touch? And, have you had a lot of sun exposure lately?
Yeah, it seems like it’s changing, and the appearance is different than before. It's not really painful or tender, just sometimes a bit itchy or tingly. I haven't been in the sun a lot lately.

Thanks for the information. Can you describe how the spot's appearance has changed over time? Have you ever had any other spots like this before, or does anyone in your family have a history of skin cancer?

I can't really put my finger on it, but this thing keeps changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before. No, I've never had anything like this before, and I don't know about family history.

Thanks. Can you be more specific about the changes in the appearance? For example, has it become more irregular in shape or developed any new colors or textures? Also, are there any other symptoms you've noticed, like a change in sensation or any new skin issues nearby?
The edges are all jagged, kinda messy, not smooth like my other moles, and there are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before.
Thank you. The jagged edges and the tiny red blood vessels are important details. Have you been exposed to any chemicals or radiation, either at work or through any medical treatments?
No, I haven’t been exposed to anything like that.

The skin around it looks red or puffy, like it’s irritated or reacting to something. Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it. And it looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away.
